Package com.web.controller

Class AccountManagmentController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.web.controller.AccountManagmentController

  • @RestController
public class AccountManagmentController
extends java.lang.Object
    AccountManagmentController, expose the user management capabilities, Add, remove and list user accounts Uses the spring source RESTful Web-Service annotations to initialize and invoke the different API calls

      Adding a new user account to the AccountService
      Account getUserAccount​(java.lang.String emailAddress, java.lang.String sessionToken)
      Look-up user account data, this method can be invoked by a logedIn Administrator or by the searched user himself

    • Method Detail

      • addNewUserAccount

        @PostMapping("/accountManagment/addNewUserAccount")
public boolean addNewUserAccount​(@RequestParam("emailAddress")
                                 java.lang.String emailAddress,
                                 @RequestParam("password")
                                 java.lang.String password)
                          throws AccountAllreadyExistException,
                                 IllegalAccountValueException
        Adding a new user account to the AccountService
        Parameters:
        emailAddress -
        password -
        Returns:
        true if the account has been created
        Throws:
        AccountAllreadyExistException - In case the user Email Address is already taken
        IllegalAccountValueException - In case Email address or password are empty

      • getUserAccount

        @PostMapping("/accountManagment/getUserAccount")
public Account getUserAccount​(@RequestParam("emailAddress")
                              java.lang.String emailAddress,
                              @RequestParam("sessionToken")
                              java.lang.String sessionToken)
                       throws ActionNotPermitedException,
                              AuthorizationSessionNotExistException
        Look-up user account data, this method can be invoked by a logedIn Administrator or by the searched user himself
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - to be looked-up
        sessionToken - logedIn user how wish to make the look-up
        Returns:
        User Account data object
        Throws:
        ActionNotPermitedException - in case the logedIn user has no look-up privileges or is not the looked-up user
        AuthorizationSessionNotExistException - in case the call is not made buy a logedIn user
